metadata.title: CVE-2019-12921 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick before 1.3.32, the text filename component allows remoteattackers to read arbitrary files via a crafted image because ofTranslateTextEx for SVG.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm1').
